definition: to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.chinese: 《威尔逊》是一部古怪的文献片，于1944年公演。

sentences.english: Life on earth is just the dress rehearsal before the real production.
sentences.chinese: 人生在世，其实只是彩排，为未来公演之日作准备。

sentences.english: The audience on the opening night of the play reached to ten thousand.
sentences.chinese: 那出戏首次公演之夜观众达万人之多。

sentences.english: The Broadway musical My Fair Lady has opened for its first night in London, to a rapturous reception.
sentences.chinese: 百老会音乐剧我的美丽天使首度伦敦公演。

sentences.english: In September 2010, a new production of The Lion King will be mounted in Singapore.
sentences.chinese: 2010年10月，新版《狮子王》将在新加坡公演。

sentences.english: Hamlet, which is a famous play by Shakespeare, was performed on stage in the new hall.
sentences.chinese: 莎士比亚的名剧《汉姆雷特》在新礼堂公演了。

sentences.english: If you do a good job, you can put on the play at the school theater festival.
sentences.chinese: 如果你们演得好，还可以在学校艺术节上公演。

sentences.english: The production of his Wilderness Men in 1985 was a real polyphony .
sentences.chinese: 1985年公演的《野人》是一部真正的复调戏剧。

definition: maiden stage role/first performance/first public showing
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
(theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances/abbr. for 巡迴演出|巡回演出[xun2 hui2 yan3 chu1]
(theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances
(of a play, movie etc) to begin
